definition[0]: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective
example[0]: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
example[1]: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
example[2]: The seats can be modified to fit other types of vehicle.
definition[1]: if an adjective, adverb etc modifies another word, it describes something or limits the word’s meaning. In the phrase ‘walk slowly’, the adverb ‘slowly’ modifies the verb ‘walk’.
definition[2]: to make changes, especially small changes, to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective
example[3]: The plan has been slightly modified.
example[4]: Banks have modified their traditional role and now offer mortgages, pensions, and other financial services.
